input.description:
String Value - The name of a configuration item defined in a configuration module.
Example: BMC_AR_System, HP_ServiceCenter,BMC_Remedyforce, ServiceNow

The name of the web services adapter to be used by this module.

Identifies the transport protocol to use for the message.
Valid Value: http-rpc

The URL for the remote SOAP service.
Valid formats: http://x.y, https://x.y

The SOAPAction HTTP request header field can be used to indicate the intent of the SOAP HTTP request. The value is a URI identifying the intent. SOAP places no restrictions on the format or specificity of the URI or that it is resolvable. An HTTP client MUST use this header field when issuing a SOAP HTTP Request.
The default value is POST.
The user name used by the web services adapter.
The password used by the web services adapter

String Value - Indicates whether or not the process completed successfully.
Valid values: success, failure
String Value - A process specific string that explains the value of success status.
An XML containing possible values for category.
An XML containing possible values for impact.
An XML containing possible values for urgency.
An XML containing possible values to create task relationships.
An XML containing possible values used during query of relationships.
An XML containing possible values workinfo mappings.
Item type is typically a task.

documentation.description: Extract Configuration Data This workflow will extract the configuration data for a given configuration name.
